FxtDocumentDescription.p: Export the interlinear text as a sequence of examples to a basic XLingPaper document which can then be used to cut and paste into another XLingPaper document (e.g. the XLingPaper form of the Grammar Sketch).
The interlinear is like you see in FLEx. Note that this format does *not* correspond with the Leipzig glossing rules (see http://www.eva.mpg.de/lingua/resources/glossing-rules.php).

XLingPaper is a way to write linguistic papers using XML technologies. Some of us like using the freely available XMLmind XML Editor with the XLingPaper configuration files for XMLmind to do this editing. See http://www.xlingpaper.org or the installation CD at D:\FieldWorks\XML Utilities\XLingPap.htm.
